{{cpp/container/list/title|size}}
{{cpp/container/list/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|until=c++11|
size_type size() const;
}}
{{dcl|since=c++11|
size_type size() const noexcept;
}}

{{dcl end}}

Returns the number of elements in the container, i.e. {{c|std::distance(begin(), end())}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The number of elements in the container.

===Complexity===
{{rev begin}}
{{rev|until=c++11|Constant or linear.}}
{{rev|since=c++11|Constant.}}
{{rev end}}

===Example===
{{example
|The following code uses {{tt|size}} to display the number of elements in a {{lc|std::list}}:
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;list&gt;
 
int main()
{ 
    std::list&lt;int&gt; nums{1, 3, 5, 7};
 
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "nums contains " &lt;&lt; nums.size() &lt;&lt; " elements.\n";
}
|output=
nums contains 4 elements.
}}
